| HistoryText             = The '''Keepers of the [[Great Silver Gate]]''' are unidentified beings, seemingly the guardians of the [[Higher Dimension]], where no [[Homo sapiens|human]] sorcerer had ever accessed before.<!-- {{r|Marvel Fanfare #52|; Mirror, Mirror}} -->

As [[Aleister Kane (Earth-616)|Aleister Kane]] used [[black magic]] along with mirrors to demonstrate his pet theory which involved using mirrors set in the right configuration in order to open up a passage to the Higher Dimension, the Keepers of the Great Silver Gate condemned him to be trapped in an unnamed dimension, tormented on a force-wheel of light. They became the masters of Aleister's subconscious, channeling their power through it, harassing him with monsters born from his own twisted psyche.<!-- {{r|Marvel Fanfare #52|; Mirror, Mirror}} -->

Aleister managed to sent a call towards his past friend [[Stephen Strange (Earth-616)|Stephen Strange]]. Finally hearing his call for help, Strange managed to rejoin Aleister, but had no way to free his friend. Aleister urged Strange to save his soul by the only possible way: destroying the force-wheel. Strange blasted it, freeing Aleister's soul while his body was destroyed and Strange was returned to his plane.{{r|Marvel Fanfare #52|; Mirror, Mirror}}

P. Lovecraft]] and [[E. Hoffmann Price]].
